|wi2_if_name = |rad2mod = Agere PC50E-8-FC/A |rad2modif = PCMCIA (32-bit) |wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Atheros;AR5210; |rad2chip2 = Atheros;AR5110; |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== Although wikidevi.wi-cat.ru shows wifi on this device, there is no indication that any PCMIA cards are installed in this new.
Device uses a StrongARM SA-110 (part number 21281EB), Intel 21285AB, TI PCIbus PCI1225PDV for the PC Card controller, and DP83815CVNG for the ethernet controller.
The AP-2000 (with Lucent/Agere/Proxim's firmware) can function as a 802.11b access point using an [[ORiNOCO PC Card]] or [[ORiNOCO PC Card (Ruby)]], an 802.11bg access point using a [[Proxim 8800-FC]], and an 802.11a access point using an [[Agere PC50E-8-FC/A]].
Sold by '''[[Dell]]''' as the TrueMobile 1170.
Some AP2ks have native POE capability - for example, the [[Agere ORiNOCO AP-2000 AE]]. This specific one, as shown in the photos, specifically does not appear to. The non-POE capable AP-2ks could use optional POE splitters, which were frequently used with a proprietary PowerDsine 48V system.
==Pictures== <center>'''User Images''' <gallery mode="slideshow"> File:Proxim AP-2000 rev A5 board top.jpg|board top File:Proxim AP-2000 rev A5 board bot.jpg|board bottom </gallery></center>[[Has images::internal| ]]
==See also== *[[Agere ORiNOCO AP-2000 AE]] *[[Lucent ORiNOCO AS-2000]] *[[Proxim ORiNOCO AP-2000]]
